copy-screenshot-with-pause-menu-on.name: Screenshots with pause menus are copied on...
copy-screenshot-with-pause-menu-on.description:
When screenshotting a level (both gameplay and editor) while paused, PRNTSCRN will screenshot both the pause menu and the level itself. However, there is only enough room for one screenshot to be sent to the clipboard.

By default, PRNTSCRN copies screenshots of the level itself during regular gameplay, and copies the screenshot of the pause menu when building/editing a level. Here, you'll decide when to copy the screenshot containing a pause menu when screenshotting a level (either in regular gameplay or the level editor).

hide-player.name: Hide Player
hide-player.description:
Hides both players when taking a screenshot
while playing a level or while inside the level editor.

<cy>Note that not everything can be hidden;</c>
<cy>dash fire sprites and ghost icon trails</c>
<cy>may still be visible in some cases.</c>
<cy>To hide them more consistently during gameplay,</c>
<cy>find the</c> <cl>"No Ghost Trail"</c> <cy>toggle in</c> <cl>Eclipse Menu</c>
<cy>and the</c> <cl>"Hide Player Dash Fire"</c> <cy>toggle in</c> <cl>KrazyPlayLayer</c><cy>.</c>

hide-ui.name: Hide UI
hide-ui.description:
Hides the UI when taking a screenshot
while playing a level or while inside the level editor.

use-window-width.name: Use Window Width For Resolution Width

resolution-width.name: Resolution Width
resolution-width.description: The width of your screenshot, if not using the window's width.

use-window-height.name: Use Window Height For Resolution Height

resolution-height.name: Resolution Height
resolution-height.description: The height of your screenshot, if not using the window's height.

jpeg-mafia.name: Save Screenshots as JPEG
jpeg-mafia.description: Use JPEG for images instead of PNG.

auto-screenshot.name: Auto Screenshot
auto-screenshot.description:
Automatically take a screenshot with a given percentage interval (for Classic levels)
or a timed interval in seconds (for Platformer levels).

<cy>Might cause occasional FPS drops.</c>

auto-percent.name: Auto Screenshot Percentage Interval (Classic levels)
auto-percent.description: Set the percentage interval for automatic screenshots in Classic levels.

auto-seconds.name: Auto Screenshot Seconds Interval (Platformer levels)
auto-seconds.description: Set the timed interval in seconds for automatic screenshots in Platformer levels.

play-sfx.name: Play Screenshot SFX
play-sfx.description: So you actually know if your screenshot went through.

show-more-details.name: Display More Settings Values in Eclipse Menu (READ!)
show-more-details.description:
<cp>REQUIRES RESTART TO APPLY CHANGES.</c>

Shows non-boolean settings values in Eclipse Menu. Recommended for Eclipse Menu's Panel layout only.
